headline: Egg Roll Bowl
description: This breakfast egg roll bowl features all the basic egg roll ingredients (pork, cabbage, soy sauce, and sesame oil) with no deep-fried wrappers.
name: Egg Roll Bowl

recipeInstructions.text: Cook and stir sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease.

Stir coleslaw mix, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic into the skillet. Cook until coleslaw softens, about 8 minutes. Stir in lemon zest and cilantro; cook until the flavors combine, about 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I make many versions of this every week. I prefer using ground turkey instead of pork. I add all sorts of veggies, depending on what's in my fridge. Love Love Love it!

I have been making this recipe ever since I found it on FB a couple of years ago. We love the ease and flavor of this recipe. We have tried many eating vessel styles and settled on a lettace wrap style. Once I make it my husband can't stop eating it.

My ingredients vary. I have used ground beef and diced chicken breast. I toss in a half bag of stir fry veggies, bean sprouts and water chestnuts into the mix with a little oyster and soy sauce. Red pepper flakes and you have a great meal.
My husband and I enjoyed this so much. I took leftovers for lunch. It was easy and very tasty.
Made with pure chopped beef. Didn't use and cilantro and only used have the spices it called for. It was so quick and easy.
Very tasty! Had alot of flavor. This will go into the "likes" kitchen recipes for sure.

I made the recipe as directed. As others have said, I think the recipe calls for too much sesame oil. I added a teaspoon each of rice vinegar and chili garlic sauce. It cut the richness and added a little heat.
Easy and delicious. Didn't make through the night. Everybody ate it and every drop. I didn't even have any for lunch the next day!!! Also this make a great stir fry when mixed with rice!!!

I make this recipe all of the time now. My whole family loves it. Because i have a large family, i do mix ground beef and pork. I also add Chinese 5 Spice powder to my ground meat mixture and use both red and green cabbage. Turns out delicious everytime!
Fast and easy, great taste
Love this easy recipe. I have used ground beef but my favorite thing to use is salad shrimp. I use a little bit of the toasted sesame oil to saute the shrimp then follow the recipe.

This recipe calls for way too much Toasted Sesame Oil (1 to 1.5 tablespoons should be plenty). I think you can also use less soy sauce. Otherwise, I have made Egg Roll in a Bowl before and is was a great recipe. This will be very good with some slight changes
This is a family favorite! We serve it over lo mein!
Great flavor and so easy to make!
Great flavor and so easy to make!
Yes and yes
Made this several times. Always delicious!
Made a double batch, used ground beef instead of pork. Good.
Great idea. Very tasty and easy to make.
I followed the recipe, but didnâ€™t add the lemon zest. My husband loved it!!
Great taste even though I did not add lemon zest. Substituted chicken for sausage. Added zucchini for additional veggies and turned out wonderful!
I used hamburger instead of sausage and onions and portabella mushrooms also. Truly a quick and delicious meal. I omitted the sesame oil .

This was a hit at my home. I have made this twice. I shredded a head of cabbage and a couple of carrots the 1st time. This gave a much better flavor than the bag coleslaw, which was still delicious and much simpler to make on a weeknight. I replaced the pork with ground chicken and served over rice. I also added some Thai chili spice to give it some kick.
I made this in my Instant Pot using 1 lb of ground chicken. I also used Trader Joe's Asian Dipping Sauce instead of soy sauce and it was a home run! I'll be making again.
Great meal! Made as directed. LOVED it! Making it again soon

I made this, with a few changes ,for a church dinner. I used ground pork/ ground beef mixture and added teriyaki sauce and just a little brown sugar. It disappeared quickly and I had numerous request for the recipe.

I have made this from another recipe and its very easy and tasty. The only difference is my recipe uses 1 tsp of sesame oil, 1/2 cup soy sauce and 1 tsp rice wine vinegar. I like those ratios better than this recipes. I think it is a matter of taste. But it's a great recipe and I recommend it highly.
